instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with a shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>  and PCH power rail, replaced the PCH, short is now gone but im stuck missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>.

PCH is soldered well and i never really have an issue during fitting, I changed the PCH once more just encase i got a defective chip or ran the profile to aggressively.

Still the same symptoms. <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> missing. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> Present, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> Present. PP3v42 Present, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> present. Racking my head on this one. No fan activity atall and the bench power supply pulls 0.04A rather than 0.031A on other S5 boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Check everything on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, could be more stuff fried? Output of <CHIP>U7740</CHIP>? <CHIP>U7930</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7740</CHIP> is no stuff on this board. <SIGNAL>SUS_PGOOD_MR_L</SIGNAL> is present,. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present at <CHIP>U7930</CHIP>. 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is not shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> also goes to the ROM chip, maybe that got fried. Pull it and see if you can read it

Scrap that it would not affect <SIGNAL>SLP_SUS</SIGNAL> creation

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: If you have a good board to compare I would compare all input signals to the PCH power management block on page 19.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yes, my personal machine is an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
I will do some more measurements, this ones not a hurried job so i can take time.
